Hydroxychloroquine, a derivative of the antimalaria drug chloroquine, is widely used in European and American countries. Clinical studies of hydroxychloroquine as a single agent or as an adjunctive therapy are underway. In an early nonrandomized controlled trial in France, hydroxychloroquine in combination with Azithromycin significantly reduced the viral road,
45 but other studies failed to show this effect.
